info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 5:10PM CDT until August 10 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
FFWARX
The National Weather Service in La Crosse has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Clayton County in northeastern Iowa...
* Until 815 PM CDT.
* At 510 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Hourly rainfall rates will be up to 2 inches. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain fell earlier in the day. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Guttenberg, Elkader, Strawberry Point, Garnavillo, Volga, North Buena Vista, St. Olaf, Garber, Osterdock, Clayton, Elkport, Millville, Motor, Communia, Littleport, Clayton Center, Mederville, Osborne, Wood and Updegraff.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
